instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message:
Hi, I have this board with no <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, the voltages and values of the resistors around <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> are ok, but I still get .700v at PIN 5 and 8 and acording to me the correct value should be 1,07. at PIN 1 <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> I get .690v which I think is good enough.
Already removed 1 by 1 the resistors from <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>-69 leaving <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> in place and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> doesnÂ´t comes high. 
what am I missing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> is a redundant protection, not really needed.
Check the board removing it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message:
0.7V is fine on the base of the BJTs inside <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message: When removed I get the same behavior, I ger .033v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message:
Once <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> out of board, start removing the other resistors (one by one) from <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> not present
threads.message: When I removed <RESISTOR>R8168</RESISTOR> the board whent to .600A, so the problem should be on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> right?
